description:
NTS Map:92F1.  Sandwell Provincial Park has an 800 metre trail through the woods that leads to a long sandy beach on Lock Bay. The beach has views of the Strait of Georgia, and prehistoric petroglyphs carved into the sandstone rocks, east of the day-use area. This site is only accessible at low tide. The final portion of the trail to the beach is very steep and slippery.

The 12 hectare park has pit toilets and picnic tables at the beach.
directions: BC Ferries from Nanaimo to Gabriola Island. Take North Road from Gabriola Island ferry terminal, turn left on Barrett Road, and follow the park signs to the parking lot on Strand Road.
title: Sandwell Provincial Park
